DataElement.preferredName: Neoplasm Not Visible on Computed Tomography Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator to signify whether or not a tumor is not seen with a  CT scan.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Neoplasm Not Visible on Computed Tomography
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A type of computer tomography whereby a contrast medium is administered intravenously or orally prior to X-ray imaging._Perceptible especially by the eye; open to easy view._(TOO-mer) An abnormal mass of tissue that results from excessive cell division. Tumors perform no useful body function. They may be benign (not cancerous) or malignant (cancerous)._A method of examining structures within the body by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis._An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._Perceptible especially by the eye; open to easy view.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A series of detailed pictures of areas inside the body; the pictures are created by a computer linked to an x-ray machine.

Concepts.definition: A method of examining structures within the body by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis.

Property.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:Perceptible especially by the eye; open to easy view.:(TOO-mer) An abnormal mass of tissue that results from excessive cell division. Tumors perform no useful body function. They may be benign (not cancerous) or malignant (cancerous).

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
Perceptible especially by the eye; open to easy view.
(TOO-mer) An abnormal mass of tissue that results from excessive cell division. Tumors perform no useful body function. They may be benign (not cancerous) or malignant (cancerous).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
